Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery wine-jar, the interior is partially covered with an off-white granular deposit, the exterior is covered with a dark red-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text, giving a date and recording the contents as being wine.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Prof Walter B Emery
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393754) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393754)
